| dominant-interfering p53 |

Explanation:
The only disease-related entity mentioned in the paragraph is "dominant-interfering p53." It is a type of mutated p53 protein that interferes with the normal function of the p53 gene, which plays a crucial role in preventing cancer. In the given paragraph, mice express this mutated form of p5

| Disease |

| dominant-interfering p53 |

Explanation:
The only disease-related entity mentioned in the paragraph is "dominant-interfering p53." Although p53 is a gene and not a disease, the phrase "dominant-interfering p53" implies that it is a mutated form of the p53 protein that interferes with the normal function of the p53 gene, which plays a crucial role in preventing cancer. Therefore, it can be considered a disease entity in this context.
